dcterms:creator: Shirley Anugrah Hayati
Dongyeop Kang
Lyle Ungar
dcterms:description: HUMMINGBIRD is a multi-style dataset annotated with human perception scores on its important stylistic lexicons. It contains 500 sentences based on eight style datasets: politeness, sentiment, offensiveness, and five emotions (anger, disgust, fear, joy, and sadness). Each word in a sentence is annotated by three different crowd workers with a score indicating whether they perceive the word as stylistic.
dcterms:title: HUMMINGBIRD

dcterms:creator: Shirley Anugrah Hayati
Dongyeop Kang
Lyle Ungar
dcterms:description: ORIGINAL datasets are used to curate HUMMINGBIRD and consist of various publicly available datasets for style classification tasks. These datasets include politeness, sentiment, offensiveness, and emotions, with binary labels for each style.
dcterms:title: ORIGINAL datasets

dcterms:creator: Niculescu-Mizil Cristian Danescu
Moritz Sudhof
Dan Jurafsky
Jure Leskovec
Christopher Potts
dcterms:description: The Politeness dataset contains instances of polite and impolite sentences collected from StackExchange and Wikipedia requests, used for analyzing politeness in social interactions.
dcterms:title: Politeness dataset

dcterms:creator: Richard Socher
Alex Perelygin
Jean Wu
Jason Chuang
Christopher D. Manning
Andrew Ng
Christopher Potts
dcterms:description: The Sentiment dataset is a collection of movie review texts used for sentiment analysis, providing a sentiment treebank for recursive deep models.
dcterms:title: Sentiment dataset

dcterms:creator: Thomas Davidson
Dana Warmsley
Michael Macy
Ingmar Weber
dcterms:description: The Offensiveness dataset is designed for automated hate speech detection and includes instances of offensive language collected from social media.
dcterms:title: Offensiveness dataset

dcterms:creator: Saif Mohammad
Felipe Bravo-Marquez
Mohammad Salameh
Svetlana Kiritchenko
dcterms:description: The Emotions dataset is collected from tweets and is used for emotion detection, focusing on five specific emotions: anger, disgust, fear, joy, and sadness.
dcterms:title: Emotions dataset

dcterms:creator: Dorottya Demszky
Dana Movshovitz-Attias
Jeongwoo Ko
Alan Cowen
Gaurav Nemade
Sujith Ravi
dcterms:description: GoEmotions is a dataset of fine-grained emotions collected from Reddit comments, providing a rich resource for emotion classification tasks.
dcterms:title: GoEmotions corpus

dcterms:creator: Bryan Klimt
Yiming Yang
dcterms:description: The Enron email corpus is a dataset of emails from the Enron Corporation, widely used for various NLP tasks including email classification and analysis.
dcterms:title: Enron email corpus

dcterms:creator: Jianmo Ni
Jiacheng Li
Julian McAuley
dcterms:description: The Amazon review dataset consists of product reviews from Amazon, used for sentiment analysis and recommendation tasks.
dcterms:title: Amazon review dataset

dcterms:creator: Marcos Zampieri
Shervin Malmasi
Preslav Nakov
Sara Rosenthal
Noura Farra
Ritesh Kumar
dcterms:description: The OffensEval dataset is designed for identifying and categorizing offensive language in social media, providing a benchmark for evaluating models on this task.
dcterms:title: OffensEval dataset
